intro: Macrocnemum rotundatum, commonly known as the roundleaf water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its rounded, leathery leaves that are typically submerged or floating in freshwater habitats. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread along the bottom of ponds and slow-moving streams. Its fronds are often divided into small, lance-shaped segments, and it produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves. This plant is well adapted to moist environments and plays a role in maintaining water quality by filtering sediments and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
